metadata.title: CVE-2012-6700 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The decode_search function in dhcp.c in dhcpcd 3.x does not properly freeallocated memory, which allows remote DHCP servers to cause a denial ofservice via a crafted response.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6700` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dhcpcd - 3.2.3-11+deb7u1build0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dhcpcd package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.2.3-11+deb7u1build0.14.04.1').
